name: Crash Test Dummies: A Worm's Life Online Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: How many songs from "A Worm's Life" were made into music videos?
questions.explanation:
Two.

	Both "He Liked To Feel It" and "My Own Sunrise" were made into music videos. "He Liked To Feel It" was very graphic and the video was censored in the USA and banned in Canada.

questions.text: Some methods of tooth removal are detailed in "He Liked To Feel It". Which of these is NOT discussed?
questions.correct: Hitting yourself in the face to get the tooth out.
options: Using pliers to get the teeth out
Tying the tooth to a doorknob and slamming the door
Tying the tooth to a dog and playing fetch
questions.explanation:
Hitting yourself in the face to get the tooth out.

	The boy tries both the dog and the doorknob methods to get his teeth out because, as the title says, "He Liked To Feel It". The boy's father removed the tooth with pliers, which the boy did not enjoy.

questions.text: What was unusual about the woman in "Overachievers"?
questions.explanation:
She had a beard.

	"Overachievers" details three people who go a bit too far to achieve their goals. The woman in the song wanted to be close to God, so she asked to be made ugly so men would not bother her. In response, God gave her a full beard.

questions.text: In the title track, "A Worm's Life", what has the worm tasted?
questions.explanation:
Guacamole.

	"Although you think me cold and slimyI've got a nice home.I've tasted your best guacamoleAnd siesta'd at noon in the cool of the soil."

questions.text: What food does the driver recommend in the song "Our Driver Gestures"?
questions.explanation:
Souffle.

	"Plumbing often varies in the various different countriesI like to crouch down and turn on those bidetsI'll have a cocktail, pick at my fingernailsAnd then I'll squat down for a wash to end the dayOur driver recommends we try the souffle."

questions.text: In "My Enemies", the singer tries to see his enemies as little baby ducks.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The singer tries to see his enemies as harmless bunnies, but isn't able to do so: "I sit and concentrate, and try hard not to hate my enemiesI try to picture them dressed up as furry little bunniesBut when I look into their glass eyesI can see they're cold and hard and pink."

questions.text:
Complete the lyric from "There Are Many Dangers": "There are many dangers
They could be in a ________ or a common thing
You must keep a lookout
Remember all the rules they have for everything."
questions.explanation:
Toaster.

	"There Are Many Dangers" offers some practical advice like not to stick a fork in a toaster while it is turned on and not to stick your tongue to metal poles when it is cold.

questions.text: Which one of these things is the singer not outlived by in "I'm Outlived By That?"
questions.explanation:
Garbage cans.

	The chorus to this song is as follows: "Ha-ha, I'm outlived by that thing and stupid things like that./Ha-ha, I'm outlived by that thing and stupid things like that."

questions.text: In "All of This Ugly", what was the singer's former profession?
questions.explanation:
Garbageman.

	"When my job was garbagemanI'd go out and empty the garbage cansAnd I'd come upon some rotting remainsBut we'd drive them outside townAnd fill the land, and make hills that you could walk around on."

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "I'm A Dog": "How come all your poets fall into ______________?"
questions.explanation:
Despondencies & Despondencys.

	"How come all your poets fall into despondencies?And then write it down for us to read every indignity?Not such worthy specimens, these creaturesHardly fit for what you could call the good life."
